meanings.definition: A group of peptides that inhibit the release of growth hormone and other hormones
meanings.sent1: Somatostatins help stop the body from making too much growth hormone.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study somatostatins to understand how they affect hormone levels.
meanings.sent3: The somatostatins decided to throw a party and invite all the other hormones.
meanings.sent4: The somatostatins act like traffic lights, controlling the flow of hormones in the body.
meanings.sent5: Imagine somatostatins as gatekeepers, preventing the excess release of hormones.

meanings.definition: Hormones that regulate the endocrine system
meanings.sent1: The somatostatins play a crucial role in balancing the endocrine system.
meanings.sent2: Endocrinologists study somatostatins to understand their impact on the body.
meanings.sent3: The somatostatins organized a meeting to discuss their duties in the endocrine system.
meanings.sent4: Somatostatins are like conductors orchestrating the functions of the endocrine system.
meanings.sent5: In the body's orchestra, somatostatins ensure harmony among the hormones.

meanings.definition: Peptides that control the secretion of various hormones in the body
meanings.sent1: Researchers are investigating how somatostatins manage hormone secretion.
meanings.sent2: Understanding somatostatins is key to unraveling hormone regulation.
meanings.sent3: The somatostatins held a contest to see who could control hormone secretion the best.
meanings.sent4: Somatostatins act like guardians, monitoring the release of hormones in the body.
meanings.sent5: Picture somatostatins as traffic controllers directing the flow of hormones.
